M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PlumbingUti.desc: Connects placeholders that looks like Cross connection.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PlumbingUti.title: PlumbingUtils.ConnectPipePlaceholdersAtCross(Document, Connector, Connector, Connector, Connector) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PlumbingUti.desc: Connects placeholders that looks like Cross connection.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PlumbingUti.sig:
public static bool ConnectPipePlaceholdersAtCross(
	Document document,
	Connector connector1,
	Connector connector2,
	Connector connector3,
	Connector connector4
)
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PlumbingUti.remarks: The placeholders may or may not have physical connection. However a) The ends of four connectors should intersect at same point; b) the first and second placeholders should be collinear each other; c) the third and fourth placeholders should be collinear each other and d) the third and fourth should have intersection with first or second placeholder. If connection fails, the placeholders cannot be physically connected.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.Pipe.Create.title: Pipe.Create(Document, ElementId, ElementId, Connector, Connector) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.Pipe.Create.desc: Creates a new pipe that connects to two connectors.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.Pipe.Create.sig:
public static Pipe Create(
	Document document,
	ElementId pipeTypeId,
	ElementId levelId,
	Connector startConnector,
	Connector endConnector
)
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.Pipe.Create.remarks: The new pipe will have the same diameter and system type as the start connector. The creation will also connect the new pipe to two component who owns the specified connectors. If necessary, additional fitting(s) are included to make a valid connection. If the new pipe can not be connected to the next component (e.g., mismatched direction, no valid fitting, and etc), the new pipe will still be created at the specified connector position, and an InvalidOperationException is thrown.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipingSyste.title: PipingSystem.GetFlow Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipingSyste.desc: Gets the flow of this piping system.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipingSyste.remarks: The system flow is calculated in the non-blocking evaluation framework. The caller may set up callbacks that react to the asynchronous calculation results. If no callback is set up (e.g, called from third-party applications), the calculation is automatically switched to synchronous calculation so the caller can access the up-to-date result. Similarly, the public method get_ParameterValue(BuiltInParameter.RBS_PIPE_FLOW_PARAM) has the same behavior. Due to this change, the parameter RBS_PIPE_FLOW_PARAM no longer supports dynamic model update.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipeSetting.desc: Gets the list of specific fitting angles.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipeSetting.remarks: Revit will only use the angles specified during the pipe layout or modifying the pipe layout. When laying out the pipes, if the angle between two pipes is close to the allowed angle, the specific angle is used for that pipe fitting.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PlumbingUti.title: PlumbingUtils.ConnectPipePlaceholdersAtTee(Document, Connector, Connector, Connector) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PlumbingUti.desc: Connects three placeholders that looks like Tee connection.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PlumbingUti.remarks: The three placeholders may or may not have physically connections. However, the first one should be collinear with the second and third one must have intersection with first and second. If first placeholder and second placeholder have the same size, the second one is merged with first one and original placeholder element will be invalid. If connection fails, the placeholders cannot be physically connected.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipePressur.title: PipePressureDropData.Viscosity Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipePressur.desc: The dynamic viscosity of the pipe. Units: (kg/(ftÂ·s)).

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipePressur.title: PipePressureDropData.KLevel Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipePressur.desc: The system calculation level.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PlumbingUti.title: PlumbingUtils.ConnectPipePlaceholdersAtTee(Document, ElementId, ElementId) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PlumbingUti.desc: Connects two placeholders that looks like Tee connection.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PlumbingUti.remarks: The second placeholder must have physically connection with the first one. If connection fails, the placeholders cannot be physically connected.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PlumbingUti.title: PlumbingUtils.PlaceCapOnOpenEnds Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PlumbingUti.desc: Places caps on the open connectors of the pipe curve, pipe fitting or pipe accessory.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PlumbingUti.remarks: In order to place the cap, the cap type should be defined in the routing preferences that associates with the pipe type of the given element. If the typeId is a valid element id, it will be used to override the pipe type that associates with the pipe type of the given element.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.Pipe.IsPipi.title: Pipe.IsPipingSystemTypeId Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.Pipe.IsPipi.desc: Checks if given type is valid piping system type.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipeSetting.title: PipeSettings.AnalysisForClosedLoopHydronicPipingNetworks Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipeSetting.desc: Indicates whether to enable analysis for closed loop hydronic piping networks.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipeSetting.remarks: For closed loop hydronic piping networks, Revit can analyze flow and pressure values for supply and return loops. In the model, select a pump to see the results of the analysis in the Properties palette.A closed loop hydronic piping network must contain:A single pump/circulatorA single source, such as a boilerMultiple piping segmentsMultiple terminals, such as radiators.A network may contain a direct return loop or a reverse return loop.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipePressur.title: PipePressureDropData.Friction Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipePressur.desc: The friction of the pipe. Units: (kg/(ftÂ²Â·sÂ²)).

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.FluidType.G.title: FluidType.GetTemperature Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.FluidType.G.desc: Gets a copy of the FluidTemperature object matching a given temperature value.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.FluidType.G.remarks: Changes made to this object will not be applied to the FluidType object. In order to modify the FluidTemperature settings for a given temperature, you should remove the existing FluidTemperature (RemoveTemperature()) and then add the modified value (AddTemperature()).

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipeSetting.title: PipeSettings.IsValidSpecificFittingAngle Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipeSetting.desc: Checks that the given value is a valid specific fitting angle. The specific fitting angles are angles of 90, 60, 45, 30, 22.5 or 11.25 degrees.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipingSyste.title: PipingSystem.GetFixtureUnits Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipingSyste.desc: Gets the fixture units of this piping system.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipingSyste.remarks: The system fixture units is calculated in the non-blocking evaluation framework. The caller may set up callbacks that react to the asynchronous calculation results. If no callback is set up (e.g, called from third-party applications), the calculation is automatically switched to synchronous calculation so the caller can access the up-to-date result. Similarly, the public method get_ParameterValue(BuiltInParameter.RBS_PIPE_SYSTEM_FIXTURE_UNIT_PARAM) has the same behavior. Due to this change, the parameter RBS_PIPE_SYSTEM_FIXTURE_UNIT_PARAM no longer supports dynamic model update.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipePressur.title: PipePressureDropData.IsValidObject Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipePressur.desc: Specifies whether the .NET object represents a valid Revit entity.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipePressur.remarks: If the corresponding Revit native object is destroyed, or creation of the corresponding object is undone, a managed API object containing it is no longer valid. API methods cannot be called on invalidated wrapper objects.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipePressur.title: PipePressureDropData.Coefficient Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipePressur.desc: The coefficient of the pipe.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.Pipe.Create.title: Pipe.Create(Document, ElementId, ElementId, Connector, XYZ) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.Pipe.Create.desc: Creates a new pipe that connects to the connector.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.Pipe.Create.sig:
public static Pipe Create(
	Document document,
	ElementId pipeTypeId,
	ElementId levelId,
	Connector startConnector,
	XYZ endPoint
)
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.Pipe.Create.remarks: The new pipe will have the same diameter and system type as the specified connector. The creation will also connect the new pipe to the component who owns the specified connector. If necessary, additional fitting(s) are included to make a valid connection. If the new pipe can not be connected to the next component (e.g., mismatched direction, no valid fitting, and etc), the new pipe will still be created at the specified connector position, and an InvalidOperationException is thrown.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.Pipe.PipeTy.desc: The pipe type of this pipe.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipingSyste.desc: Indicates if the system is well connected or not.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipingSyste.remarks: If the system is not well connected, parameters which need to be calculated are invalid.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipingSyste.title: PipingSystem.GetStaticPressure Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipingSyste.desc: Gets the static pressure of this piping system.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Plumbing.PipingSyste.remarks: The system static pressure is calculated in the non-blocking evaluation framework. The caller may set up callbacks that react to the asynchronous calculation results. If no callback is set up (e.g, called from third-party applications), the calculation is automatically switched to synchronous calculation so the caller can access the up-to-date result. Similarly, the public method get_ParameterValue(BuiltInParameter.RBS_PIPE_STATIC_PRESSURE) has the same behavior. Due to this change, the parameter RBS_PIPE_STATIC_PRESSURE no longer supports dynamic model update.
